ch.ethz.csb.youscope.client.addon.tool
Interface ToolAddon

All Known Implementing Classes:
CustomMicroplates, DeviceSettingManager, MeasurementViewer, MultiStream, PositionControl, YouPong
public interface ToolAddon

Author:
langmo Interface for addons which implement custom jobs.

Method Summary

Method Detail

createUI

void createUI(YouScopeFrame frame)
Is called when the tool should start to do whatever it is made to do. The tool should either provide some possibilities for the user to interact with it (e.g. to stop the tool doing whatever it does), which should be initialized in the frame, or a message or something similar that the tool is started, which should then be initialized in the frame. However, the frame should not be made visible.

Parameters:
frame - The frame in which the graphical elements of the tool should be initialized.

callMethod

java.lang.Object callMethod(java.lang.String methodName,
                            java.lang.Object[] parameters)
                            throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                   java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
Function to call methods of a tool, which the tool exposes to the outside world. With this function it is possible for tools to cooperate. The description of all supported methods should be returned by getMethodDescriptions(). The simplest implementation of this method just throws a NoSuchMethodException at every call, indicating that this tool does not support further communication to other parts of YouScope except being started (by calling createUI()) and then working autonomously.

Parameters:
methodName - The name of the method to be invoked.
parameters - Array of parameters the method should be invoked with.
Returns:
The return value of the method, or null, if it does not return any value.
Throws:
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - thrown, if no method with the given name is exposed to the outside world.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown, if a method with the given name is exposed, but either the number or the type of the parameters is wrong.
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - thrown, when the method with the given name was successfully called, but produced some internal error which is wrapped in this exception.

getMethodDescriptions

java.lang.String[] getMethodDescriptions()
Returns a list of descriptions of the exposed methods, their functions and how they should be called. Each element of the list should correspond to one unique function. If no method is exposed, an empty array is returned. The output of this function is for information only and should not be computationally analyzed. Although the exact form of the method description is implementation depended, the general guideline is that the descriptions should be of the following form: ReturnType methodName(Parameter1Type parameter1Name, ..., ParameterNType parameterNName)\nDescription As an example a returned string could be Boolean runFile(String engine, File scriptFile)\nRuns the script file scriptFile with a script engine with the given name. Returns true if successful.

Returns:
Array of tool's method descriptions.
